intro: Erigeron cervinus, commonly known as blueweed or nodding fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its blue to violet flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
